title: Love Island Australia fans are 'put off' by the gloomy and overcast weather
text:
A group of genetically-blessed singletons arrived at the Love Island Australia villa in Fiji on Monday.

But unfortunately viewers didn't get the opportunity to see the picturesque views the popular tourist destination is famous for.

Many fans were left disappointed by the 'gloomy' and 'overcast' weather during the season premiere.

Bad start! Many fans were left disappointed by the 'gloomy' and 'overcast' weather during the season premiere of Love Island Australia

Viewers expressed their confusion on Twitter, asking why the women were wearing bikinis when the weather looked cold, windy and miserable.

Other fans joked that the overcast conditions were 'not great for Fiji Tourism'.

Several Twitter users said they preferred the location used for the first season of Love Island, the Spanish island of Mallorca.

Aren't they cold? Viewers expressed their confusion on Twitter, asking why the women were wearing bikinis when the weather looked windy and miserable

Overcast: Viewers didn't get the opportunity to see the picturesque views Fiji is famous for

'So wish I was in Spain, the weather looks great #LoveIslandAU,' one person wrote.

Also on Monday night, fans accused Love Island of 'racism' after West-African born Cynthia Taylu was picked last during the coupling ceremony.

All of the men bypassed the 23-year-old beauty, who was paired with Sam Withers by default after she was the last female contestant without a partner.

Not happy! Several fans joked that the overcast conditions were 'not great for Fiji Tourism'

'I wish I was in Spain': Others said they preferred the location used for Love Island's first season

One person tweeted: 'The one woman of colour being chosen last by clones of the same looking guys.'

Another wrote: 'Love Island Australia has one not-white person and she didn't get picked by anyone. How have the producers not thought to run an "are you accidentally a little racist" test by contestants yet?'

A similar comment read: It's obvious they put her in as a token gesture. Australia is still a little behind the diversity thing.'
